data.title: Camera does not follow eyeMount movement
data.body:
After some initial tests and reading the docs, all first-person images with an eyeMount node should replace the "eye" node available in the third-person shape. So, if it's part of the animation or parented to any bone, it should animate the camera as well. Unfortunately, that's not happening. All of my TP player models have the eye nodes, and the FP ones have the eyeMount nodes. The camera, however, stays still at the starting position of the eyeNode.

My eyeNode is parented to the Head bone. I've also tried parenting it to the root bone, but no movement at all takes place. The camera just isn't affected. Which sucks, because animators could be responsible for creating smooth and believable bob/sway for each weapon. For example, a handgun sways the camera much harder than a rocket launcher.

data.title: Physx3 cmake
data.body:
Support for PhysX 3.x with CMake. I will make a thread very soon about this, basically NVidia doesn't supply binaries any more for PhysX and only source code access so you have to compile yourself. I will outline the steps in the forum post.

Also had to add two new macros for adding libs with CMake, addLibRelease and addLibDebug. The original addLib macro will work just as before but these two new macros allow the use of different libs for debug/release modes. The original addLib obviously still adds the lib to both builds so this will not change any other current CMake modules. Perhaps I should have split this into two separate PR's??

Tested with latest PhysX 3.3.4

data.title: Crash When Selecting Camera And Material Editor Is Open
data.body:
Does exactly as it says on the tin.
When in the editor in player view and you try and select the camera, Torque3D will crash if the Material Editor is open. Not really an important bug, just an annoying one when you forget to switch out of Material Editor first.

data.body:
Hi,

Just a small issue that I'm seeing on GuiWindowCtrl with PopUp Dialog when switching to OpenGL renderer. I also have to mention Timmy's D3D11 renderer/build as it is doing the same and for future reference.

![opengl-dx11-gui-issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3676827/11893419/6b5a31b2-a5ab-11e5-8ebe-3ebce4aa8edd.jpg)

data.title: Updated paths for collada tdictionary.h
player boundingBox collision does not rotate
data.body:
This boundingBox https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/player.cs#L569
defines the size of the collisionBox inside the game, but if you make it asymetric, it does not rotate with the player, making it useless to use any non square shape.
It is obviously thought to be used like that, so you can make the player wider than long or longer than wide, since it is like that in the default setup for the Soldier, but it does not work.
The boundingBox does rotate if you select the Player in the world editor and bulletcollisions are detected properly, but not the collisions with objects in the world.

data.title: customFootstepSound attribute not working or loading properly
data.body:
Hi,

It seems that the customFootstepSound field or attribute is not working or loaded properly.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Load **Empty Terrain.mis**
2. Open Material Editor
3. Select _TerrainFX_sand_ or any other material
4. Choose different Footstep sound with custom or existing sound effects profile (ie. **"ThrowSnd"**) then save material.
5. Exit and Restart Torque.

No console errors and the new sound does not play. Opening the material again via editor displays **None** in that field but still writes as 

`customFootstepSound = "ThrowSnd"`

with an additional `footstepSoundId = "-1";`

![issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3676827/11606934/c20d858c-9b6e-11e5-9ad3-538a250b5465.jpg)

data.title: Extacted AI tweaks:
data.body:
attackradius - seperate value/callbacks to allow AI to be coded to move and shoot.

slowdown triggered by 2x movetolerance rather than a fixed 5 untis.

void AIPlayer::updateMove(const Move\* move)  - 'lag' correction.

getTargetDistance - c side distance calculation with enabled option.

data.title: Fix NULL pointer Crashes in WorldEditor::selectObject & unselectObject
data.body:
Relatively simple fix, the engine will crash because this code fails to return if the input obj is NULL:

https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gui/worldEditor/worldEditor.cpp#L2834

Same for selectObject.
This stack is generated in unselectObject's case: http://pastebin.com/nUzFJN5u

So it pretty much just attempts to make a call against a NULL pointer if you don't give them a valid ID :) (Try EWorldEditor.unselectObject(0))

As an aside, I fixed my line endings so we don't have spastic messes for commits anymore.

data.title: WorldEditor::unselectObject Crashes when Input ID is Invalid
data.body:
Relatively simple issue, the engine will crash because this code fails to return if the input obj is NULL:

https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gui/worldEditor/worldEditor.cpp#L2834

This stack is generated: http://pastebin.com/nUzFJN5u
So it pretty much just attempts to make a call against a NULL pointer if you don't give unselectObject a valid ID :) (Try EWorldEditor.unselectObject(0))

It also looks like you probably have similar issues floating around in things like selectObject, as well.

data.title: NavMeshUpdateAll leak suppression (not 100% preventative)
data.body:
1) Reset the build when adding potential dirties to the list to ensure it isn't trying to kill off a dirty entry that it's passed by.
2) mSaveIntermediates = true; causes leakage even with all this. still tracking that end.
3) Need to remove a dead tile whether there's new data to replace it with or not. Empty tiles are an entirely possible case. Even a probable one if you have high verticality in a level.
4) Likewise you don't want to re-feed the same geometry list for a given tile in case the conditions have changed.
5) If no vertcount then clear all geometry entries. (that one might be paranoia)

data.title: [Linux] Mouse jumping to spawn sphere in world editor
data.body:
Hi!

I currently have this weird issue where my cursor will kind of jump to where ever my player is located at the moment if I hold down my left mouse button and move it. 

This creates these weird huge towers:

http://i.imgur.com/drlUeUw.png

The pink circle also kind of hangs every few seconds if I just move my mouse over terrain without doing anything, which is very weird since I'm getting well over 100 FPS in the editor. When it does this, one of my CPU cores goes to 100% and GPU usage drops to 0%. I have absolutely no idea what's causing this.

My system for reference:

http://i.imgur.com/cth8vn0.png

It's kind of usable if you do it slowly, but obviously this is game-breaking, so to speak.

Any help would be appreciated, thanks.

Edit:

Probably should have mentioned that I'm using the 3.8 precompiled binaries.

data.title: recurseDumpDirectories trims characters where it shouldn't
data.body: [scanModules](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/1a009d6dd31b66832de3b67e76465ad1f313a9dc/Engine/source/module/moduleManager.cpp#L164) will fail because it attempts to scan "rt" rather than "art."

data.title: fix for loading cached dts from zip archives
data.body:
This fixes a bug where if you attempted to load cached dts files from a zip archive it would fail. This was because it was attempting to extract the file time information from non-existent files outside of the archive. Thus, canLoadCachedDTS would return false.

I added a line to disable the file change notification errors for directories that don't exist or are in zip archive.

Additionally, I added *.pak to the search pattern for archives.

data.title: libSDL2 issues
data.body:
Hi!

I've had an issue with the precompiled binaries that I've been able to fix. Not sure if was my fault or if it's an issue with the precompiled binaries, but I felt like sharing it anyway.

Specifically I'm following these two guides from the wiki:

http://wiki.torque3d.org/introduction:your-first-project

http://wiki.torque3d.org/coder:compiling-in-linux#toc10

And I'm using the latest package (3.8) from here:

http://wiki.torque3d.org/main:downloads 

[My system](http://i.imgur.com/cth8vn0.png)

I have both sdl2 and lib32-sdl2 installed (the latter is only available in the AUR).

Running `cmake ../../../.. -DTORQUE_APP_NAME=test -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release` and `make` after that, returns no errors, but if you do `make install` after that, it says that no libSDL2.so could be found in `test/buildFiles/arch/Tools/CMake/sdl2/libSDL2.so`.

This file does exist in `/usr/lib/` and the error goes away if you do `cp /usr/lib/libSDL2.0.so ./Tools/CMake/sdl2/`

Now if you try to run `My Projects/test/game/game`, it will say this:

`./game: error while loading shared libraries: /HDD1/torque/My Projects/game/game/libSDL2-2.0.so.1: file too short`

The error goes away and the engine starts if you copy `/usr/lib/libSDL2-2.0.so.0` in the same directory as the executable.

Hope this helps if anyone else is having this issue. Any input as to what caused this, would also be appreciated since I'm trying to learn.
